core

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that contains the players name, their number, an icon, and input and output data streams
    Version:
    2/16/20
    Author:
    Ryan Cluff, rpcluff, rpcluff@asu.edu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean computer
      Indicates if the player is a computer
      private java.lang.String icon
      Icon used to display the player's pieces
      private java.io.DataInputStream in
      Input stream, used for read which column the player wishes to play a piece
      private java.lang.String name
      Name of the player
      private int num
      Number of the player
      private java.io.ObjectOutputStream out
      Output stream, used to update the client application
      static int PLAYER_1 
      static int PLAYER_2 
      private java.net.Socket socket
      Socket the player started

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Constructor for creating computer players

      The Player constructor.

      • isComputer

        public boolean isComputer()
        Computer accessor method.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player is controlled by the computer, false if controlled by player

      • setPlayer2

        public void setPlayer2()
        Sets an already created player to player 2. The player name will be changed to Player O and the player number will be set to 2
